docs.abstract: We present a successful realization of supersymmetric μ -hybrid inflation model based on a gauged U (1 )<SUB>B - L</SUB> extension of the minimal supersymmetric standard model, with the soft supersymmetry breaking terms are playing an important role. Successful nonthermal leptogenesis with gravitino dark matter yields a reheat temperature in the range 2 ×10<SUP>7</SUP>≲T<SUB>R</SUB>≲5 ×10<SUP>9</SUP> GeV . This corresponds to the predictions 2 ×10<SUP>-18</SUP>≲r ≲4 ×10<SUP>-13</SUP> for the tensor to scalar ratio, and -2 ×10<SUP>-6</SUP>≲d n<SUB>s</SUB>/d ln k ≲-5 ×10<SUP>-11</SUP> for the running of the scalar spectral index. The B - L breaking scale is estimated as 6 ×10<SUP>14</SUP>≲M /GeV ≲10<SUP>16</SUP> , calculated at the central value of the scalar spectral index, n<SUB>s</SUB>=0.9655 , reported by Planck 2018. Finally, in a grand unified theory setup the dimensionless string tension parameter associated with the metastable strings is in the range 10<SUP>-9</SUP>≲G μ<SUB>cs</SUB>≲10<SUP>-6</SUP> corresponding to a stochastic gravitational wave background lying within the 2 σ bound of the recent NANOGrav 12.5-yr data.
author: Afzal, Adeela
Ahmed, Waqas
Rehman, Mansoor Ur
Shafi, Qaisar
pubnote: 12 pages, 7 figures; PHYS. REV. D 105, 103539 (2022); doi:10.1103/PhysRevD.105.103539
docs.pub_raw: Physical Review D, Volume 105, Issue 10, article id.103539
title: μ -hybrid inflation, gravitino dark matter, and stochastic gravitational wave background from cosmic strings
